dmca.title: [EV1-C1239940Z] DMCA Copyright Infringement re. popsugar.com sent on behalf of Nichol
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] Posted At: Thursday, October 05, 2006 1:21 PM Posted To: DMCA Houston Conversation: [EV1-C1239940Z] DMCA Copyright Infringement re. popsugar.com sent on behalf of Nicholas J. Jollymore Subject: [EV1-C1239940Z] DMCA Copyright Infringement re. popsugar.com sent on behalf of Nicholas J. Jollymore ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. DMCA Copyright Infringement re. popsugar.com sent on behalf of Nicholas J. Jollymore Added by system at Thursday, Oct 5 2006 05:23 pm X-MailFrom: liza_mateo@timeinc.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [207.218.192.102] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Thu Oct 5 18:19:34 2006 Received: from SMTP32-FWD by mail.ev1.net (SMTP32) id A00000458; Thu, 5 Oct 2006 18:18:37 -0500 Received: from NYCGW2.TIMEINC.COM [64.236.246.215] by mail.ev1.net (SMTPD32-6.06) id A2CC58B2007A; Thu, 05 Oct 2006 18:18:36 -0500 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C6E8D4.B69E2D33" Subject: DMCA Copyright Infringement re. popsugar.com sent on behalf of Nicholas J. Jollymore Date: Thu, 5 Oct 2006 19:19:32 -0400 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: DMCA Copyright Infringement re. popsugar.com sent on behalf of Nicholas J. Jollymore Thread-Index: Acbo1LaQQftFbcKFQUq85AVAF6y/YQ== From: To: , Cc: X-OriginalArrivalTime: 05 Oct 2006 23:19:32.0304 (UTC) FILETIME=[B6BABD00:01C6E8D4] Received-SPF: none X-Declude-Sender: liza_mateo@timeinc.com [64.236.246.215] X-Spam-Tests-Failed: None [0] X-Note: This E-mail was sent from nycgw2.timeinc.com ([64.236.246.215]). (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) Dear ISP: I am an attorney for Time Inc., the corporate publisher of PEOPLE Magazine. This will put you on notice of a copyright infringement on a website hosted by Everyones Internet. PEOPLE Magazine's owns exclusive North American rights to the photographs which have been taken of Anna Nicole Smith and Howard K. Stern's wedding (or "commitment ceremony"). Some of these photographs (the "Photographs") have been posted on the web, http://popsugar.com/ (see also, http://popsugar.com/42695 ). This letter is an official notification under the provisions of Section 512(c) of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act to effect removal of this Copyright infringement. I hereby demand that you immediately (TODAY) issue a cancel message, as specified in RFC 1036, for the specified postings and prevent the infringer, who is identified by its Web address, from posting the infringing Photographs to your servers in the future. Please be advised that by law, as a service provider, you must "expeditiously remove or disable access to" the infringing Photographs upon receiving this notice. Noncompliance may result in a loss of the possibility of immunity under the DMCA. I have a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of herein is not authorized by of PEOPLE Magazine and their respective licensing representatives, or the law. The information provided herein is accurate to the best of my knowledge. I hereby swear under penalty of perjury that I am authorized to act on behalf of PEOPLE Magazine for matters pertaining to notification of infringement of its exclusive rights in its copyrighted material. Please email me, or send to me, at the address listed below, a prompt response indicating the actions you have taken to resolve this matter. Very truly yours, Nicholas J. Jollymore Deputy General Counsel Time Inc. 1271 Avenue of the Americas New York, NY 10020 ( (O) 212 522-3083 ( (F) 212 467-0844 MIME element (text/html) Message

Dear ISP:

I am an attorney for Time Inc., the corporate publisher of PEOPLE Magazine.  This will put you on notice of a copyright infringement on a website hosted by Everyones Internet.

PEOPLE Magazine’s owns exclusive North American rights to the photographs which have been taken of Anna Nicole Smith and Howard K. Stern’s wedding (or “commitment ceremony”). Some of these photographs (the “Photographs”) have been posted on the web, http://popsugar.com/  (see also,  http://popsugar.com/42695 ).

This letter is an official notification under the provisions of Section 512(c) of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act to effect removal of this Copyright infringement.  I hereby demand that you immediately (TODAY) issue a cancel message, as specified in RFC 1036, for the specified postings and prevent the infringer, who is identified by its Web address, from posting the infringing Photographs to your servers in the future. Please be advised that by law, as a service provider, you must “expeditiously remove or disable access to” the infringing Photographs upon receiving this notice. Noncompliance may result in a loss of the possibility of immunity under the DMCA.

I have a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of herein is not authorized by of PEOPLE Magazine and their respective licensing representatives, or the law.  The information provided herein is accurate to the best of my knowledge.  I hereby swear under penalty of perjury that I am authorized to act on behalf of PEOPLE Magazine for matters pertaining to notification of infringement of its exclusive rights in its copyrighted material.

Please email me, or send to me, at the address listed below, a prompt response indicating the actions you have taken to resolve this matter.

Very truly yours,

Nicholas J. Jollymore

Deputy General Counsel

Time Inc.

1271 Avenue of the Americas

New York, NY 10020

( (O) 212 522-3083

( (F) 212 467-0844

 
MIME element (text/plain)
